name: Sous Vide Hard-Boiled Eggs
author: France C
summary: If you don't like the dry yolks and rubbery whites in traditional hard-boiled eggs, try making them using your sous vide immersion cooker. The yolks come out super moist and tender and never discolored, which makes the added cook time well worth the wait! Use any number of eggs; the directions remain the same.
directions: Fill a large pot with water and place a sous vide immersion cooker into the water
Set temperature to 170 degrees F (77 degrees C) according to manufacturer's instructions
Once water is up to temp, slowly lower eggs into the water using a slotted spoon
Set timer for 40 minutes Remove eggs from water once timer is up and place in a large bowl
Slowly shake bowl around to gently crack the eggs
Cover with ice water to cool
